title: Team View: Mashup
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I set a specific OMS environment
AND when access a team view
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I expect to see a config in Charles based on the environment configured

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I set my device to Spanish language
AND I access a team view
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I expect to a config downloaded in Charles I expect to see a config in Charles based on my device’s language

title: Team View: Team Selector
custom_steps:
GIVEN a user on the team view
WHEN I tap the team name at the top of the view
THEN I should see a list of teams ordered by Favorite team
AND THEN ordered by Followed teams
AND THEN ordered by alphabetical city name

 

GIVEN a user on the team view has selected a team
WHEN I navigate to a different part of the app
AND THEN I return to the teams view
THEN the previously selected team should be visible in the toolbar
AND the team selector should not be open

title: Team View: Snapshot Schedule
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team view

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the snapshot is enabled
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should see four tabs providing me game information for the team I am currently viewing

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN it is the first day of the season (the first day of Spring Training)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN tab 1 should be the first game and tab 2-4 are the next three games of the season

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN it is a day between the first and last day of the season
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN tab 1 should be yesterday's game(or the most recent game), tab 2 should be today's game (or the next upcoming game), and tabs 3-4 should be the games that follow the game in tab 2 on the schedule.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN it is the last day of the season
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN tab 4 should be the last game and tabs 1-3 are the previous three games of the season

title: Team View: Snapshot Scoreboard
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team view

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a game in the snapshot is live
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should see the live state version of the snapshot for that game

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a game in the snapshot is pregame
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should see the pregame state version of the snapshot for that game

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a game in the snapshot is final
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should see the final/archive state version of the snapshot for that game

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a game in the snapshot is postponed
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should see the postponed state version of the snapshot for that game

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a game in the snapshot is cancelled
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should see the cancelled state version of the snapshot for that game

title: Team View: More From Section
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team view

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN I scroll down the view
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should see a list of More Info links that have been set in OMS

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN I tap on an item in the More Info Section
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should be taken to the corresponding webview

title: Team View: Tickets Module
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team view

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the Tickets module is enabled
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should see a list of upcoming games and links to purchase tickets

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN I tap on an item in the tickets module
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should be taken to a chrome tab with ticket purchase flow for that game

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN I tap “More” at the top of the tickets module
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should be taken to a chrome tab with the ticket page for that team

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the tickets module is disabled via OMS
(This can be simulated by using Charles to alter the response of team mashup endpoint (ie https://storage.mobile.mlbinfra.com/cms/search/atbat/en/android/phone/col.json for Colorado Rockies) so that "hideTicketsGames": 0 is instead "hideTicketsGames": 1)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should not see the tickets module

title: Team View: News Module
custom_steps: GIVEN a user on the team view

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN I access the news module
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should see a carousel with five recent news articles from the team I am viewing

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN swiping the carousel
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the carousel swipes

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN I tap on “See” next to the news carousel
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN I should be taken to the News Index 
AND the index is filtered for that team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN I tap on a news article thumbnail
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the news article webview for that article should be displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN I tap on a Top Stories item of `short-content` type
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the item should be opened in a webview

title: Team View: Videos
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN I access the team view
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should see a carousel with five recent videos about the team I am currently viewing

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I am on the team view
AND I tap on a video thumbnail
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the corresponding video should begin playing

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I am on the team view
AND I swipe left within the video carousel
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should be advanced through the video carousel

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I am on the team view
AND I tap on “More” above the video carousel
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should be taken to the video list view for the given team

title: Team View: set default snapshot tab as always second tab
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the Team page
custom_steps: WHEN the scoreboard snapshot loads
custom_expected: THEN the second date tab is selected

title: Hide Scores
custom_preconds: GIVEN hide scores is ON
custom_steps: WHEN viewing the Teams tab
custom_expected:
THEN results of final games are hidden on schedule tabs
AND the scoreboard card inherits the same hide scores rules as seen on the Scores tab (except the highlights carousel, which is not shown on the teams page)

title: Links Section
custom_steps:
GIVEN a user is in the MLB app
WHEN the user scrolls down on the team page
THEN the user should be presented with a two-part links section
AND the first section should have the header "[TEAM NAME] Info" followed by links to Transactions, Roster, Coaches, Stats, their division standings, and their stadium
AND the second section should have the header "More from the [TEAM NAME]" followed by links to Depth Chart, Top 30 Prospects, Trivia, Connect, and Auctions
![](index.php?/attachments/get/10691636)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user selects the Stats link in the [team] Info section
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user should be deep linked to the Stats tab AND the team should be filtered

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user selects the Standings link in the [team] Info section
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user should be deep linked to the Standings tab

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user selects any of the remaining links in either section
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user should be taken to the appropriate webview

title: Native Calendar Feature flag
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the team page is selected
AND access to the Firebase config (MLBApp Moblie/enable_native_calendar_view) is available 
(currently for Develop build, https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-mobile-npd/config)
AND it is not Postseason

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the Firebase config MLBApp Moblie/enable_native_calendar_view is set to true
AND the Calendar icon at the top right of the page is tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the native calendar page loads (currently native calendar not implemented so expected result is webview calendar, delete this note once implemented)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the Firebase config MLBApp Moblie/enable_native_calendar_view is set to false
AND the Calendar icon at the top right of the page is tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN a webview is opened similar to eg. https://www.mlb.com/app/atbat/whitesox/schedule/2021-10/list?parterId/mlbapp-android_webview

title: Team View: Apple TV+ content
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the team page on the Android app
custom_steps: WHEN there is a game being streamed on Apple TV
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see the Apple TV text/label on the tile
AND be notified through an alert message that they can watch the game on Apple TV+ once that link is tapped on

title: Team Page: preroll ads
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team page

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the use is un-entitled
AND the user selects a video from the Videos carousel
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN a preroll ad will play
AND the video will play after the preroll ad is complete

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is entitled
AND the user selects a video from the Videos carousel
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the video will play without preroll ad

title: Team View: More Videos links to Watch View
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on is a team page in the main Mobile app
custom_steps: WHEN they select “More” link in the Videos carousel
custom_expected: THEN they will be routed to the home page of the watch view

title: Page Entry
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the MLB App

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN "Teams" is tapped from the browse menu
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be taken to the team page
Note: if a team has not yet been selected they will first be taken to the team picker

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a team icon is tapped from the home page team snapshot header or matchup section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be taken to the team page
Note: if a team has not yet been selected they will first be taken to the team picker

title: Video items display and play correctly

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the Team Page is displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then all video items should display their titles, thumbnails, and play correctly when tapped

title: Team logos and schedule links are rendered correctly

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the Team Page is displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the team logos and schedule links should be rendered correctly

title: Correct layout is displayed for compact view - Invalid case??

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the device is in compact view mode
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the layout should match the compact view design

title: JSON response structure matches the expected schema

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the app makes a request to the Team Page API
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the JSON structure should match the expected schema

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the Team Page is displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the "View All" button should navigate to the correct page

title: Ticketing items display correct information and tap actions

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the Team Page is displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then ticketing items should display the correct game dates, times, team logos, and tap actions
And the "Find Seats" link should work and redirect appropriately

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the Team Page is displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then all accessibility labels (a11yLabel, a11yText, etc.) should be correctly set and convey the appropriate information

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the Team Page is displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the autoplay feature should work for items where it is enabled

title: Google banner ad is displayed correctly
custom_preconds: Given the Team Page is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is not logged in or a free user is logged in
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Google banner ad should be displayed correctly and match the specified dimensions
And the ad's tap action should redirect to the correct URL

custom_steps_separated.content: When logged in as a paid user
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then Google banner ads should not be displayed

title: All images in the carousel load correctly

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the Team Page is displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then all images in the carousel should load correctly

title: Actions triggered correctly when images are tapped

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the Team Page is displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the associated action (e.g., ToastAction, DeeplinkAction) should be triggered correctly

title: All sections are rendered correctly on the Team Page

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the app makes a request to the Team Page API
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then all sections listed in the sections array should be rendered correctly

title: Text list items rendered and function correctly

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the Team Page is displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then all text list items, including their display texts, icons, and actions, should be rendered and function correctly

title: Correct layout is displayed for wide view - only applies video play

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the device is in wide view mode
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the layout should match the wide view design

title: Team matchup details are accurate and displayed - Covered by specific Matchup cases

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the Team Page is displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the team matchup details, including the situation, metaInfo, score, and teamsInfo, should be accurate and displayed

title: DeeplinkAction URLs navigate correctly - See Product Links folder

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the Team Page is displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the URL should navigate to the correct destination within the app or on the web

title: Scoreboard details are accurately displayed - This is the Linescore for a live game

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the Team Page is displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the scoreboard details, including team logos, records, runs, and game states, should be accurately displayed
And the game descriptor and player information should be correctly rendered and accessible

title: App handles API response errors gracefully

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the app makes a request to the Team Page API
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the app should handle the error gracefully, displaying appropriate error messages or fallback content

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the Team Page is displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then all articles, including their titles, images, and tap actions, should be displayed correctly

title: Calendar bar displays game dates, team abbreviations, venues, and statuses - Covered by specific Date Bar cases

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the Team Page is displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the calendar bar should correctly display game dates, team abbreviations, venues, and statuses

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the app makes a request to the Team Page API
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the status code should be 200

title: Data is accurate and consistent across sections

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the Team Page is displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then data such as team records, scores, and player stats should be accurate and consistent across different sections of the Team Page

custom_steps_separated.content: Given errors are introduced in API responses (e.g., timeouts, 500 errors)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then observe how the Team Page handles them
And ensure the page can recover from errors without crashing or becoming unresponsive

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the Team Page is kept open for extended periods and interacted with intermittently
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then check for memory leaks, crashes, or performance degradation over time

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the Team Page contains images and videos
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then measure the time taken to load images and videos
And verify lazy loading implementation for images and videos to improve initial load time

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the Team Page is scrolled on various devices
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then test the smoothness of scrolling and measure frame rates to ensure they remain high (e.g., above 60fps)

custom_steps_separated.content: Given network interruptions are simulated while interacting with the Team Page (e.g., switching between Wi-Fi and mobile data, loss of connectivity)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then verify the page handles network changes gracefully and recovers correctly

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the API provides data for the Team Page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then monitor the response time of the API and ensure it is within acceptable limits (e.g., under 500ms)

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the Team Page is loaded
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then measure the time taken to render each section (e.g., MIG Section, Image Carousel)

custom_steps_separated.content: Given high user traffic is simulated on the Team Page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then verify the page remains stable and responsive with high concurrent user access

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the Team Page is sent to the background and then brought back to the foreground
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then ensure the page state is maintained and performance remains stable after transitions

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the Team Page is tested across different devices, operating systems, and browser versions
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then verify consistent performance and stability across all supported platforms

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the Team Page is loaded and interacted with
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then monitor CPU, memory, and battery usage
And ensure resource usage is optimized to avoid excessive battery drain or device overheating

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the Team Page is tested before and after app updates
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then ensure updates do not introduce new performance issues or instability

custom_steps_separated.content: Given the Team Page is loaded under various network conditions (e.g., 3G, 4G, Wi-Fi)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the page load time should meet acceptable thresholds (e.g., under 2 seconds on 4G)

title: Current date on or before date range
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user whose Current date is on or before the beginning of the season (or date range) (based on location)
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates the team page
custom_expected: THEN the "Featured" game will be the first game of the season and will be displayed in the first block of the date bar

title: Current date on or after date range
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user whose Current date is on or after the end of the season (or date range)
custom_steps: WHEN they navigate to the team page
custom_expected:
THEN the "featured" game will be the last game of the season
And will be displayed as the last block of the date bar

title: Device changes timezone
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the Favorite Team Snapshot
custom_steps: WHEN the device timezone changes
custom_expected:
THEN the games showing and selected game will still be based on current requirements 
AND will not change 
AND the game dates and times shown will reflect the device timezone

title: When current time is before flip time
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the NYC time is before the set fliptime (default is 10AM ET)
Note: Do not set your actual device time back to test this when it is after flip time, rather change the flip time itself
custom_steps: WHEN the date bar is viewed
custom_expected:
THEN the previous day's (ET) game will be located on the second date in the date bar
AND will be selected by default

title: When current time is after flip time
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the NYC time is after the  set fliptime (default is 10AM ET)
Note: Do not set your actual device time forward to test when it is before flip time, rather change the flip time itself

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the team has a next game
AND the team has not yet played a game today (ET)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the active game is the team’s next game

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the team has a next game
AND the team is currently playing
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the active game is the team’s current game

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the team has a next game
AND the team has played today (ET)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the active game is the team’s most recent game

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the team does not have a next game
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the active game is the team’s prior game

title: With no game scheduled for a date
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team page
custom_steps:
WHEN there is no game scheduled for a date
AND the date bar is viewed
custom_expected: THEN the date with no game scheduled will be skipped on the date bar

title: Schedule block
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team page
custom_steps: WHEN the Schedule block on the date bar is tapped
custom_expected: THEN the Team's Schedule view (Calendar/List) opens

title: When team has Away game present
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team page
custom_steps:
WHEN the team has an Away game present
AND the date bar is viewed
custom_expected: THEN the Away game will display the opponent as "@OAK" (for example)

title: When Home game is present
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team page
custom_steps:
WHEN the team has an Home game present
AND the date bar is viewed
custom_expected: THEN the Home game will display the opponent as "OAK" (for example)

title: When game is in preview
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team page
custom_steps:
WHEN there is a Scheduled game present
AND the date bar is viewed
custom_expected: THEN the Scheduled game will display the day, date, Opponent, and start time

title: When game is in progress
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team page
custom_steps:
WHEN there is a game in progress present
AND the date bar is viewed
custom_expected: THEN the game in progress will display day, date, Opponent, and "LIVE"

title: When game is in Final state
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team page
custom_steps:
WHEN there is a game in a Final state
AND it is not cancelled or postponed
AND the date bar is viewed
custom_expected:
THEN the date, day and opponent are displayed
AND the final result and score (ex. L 2-3) note: Favorite team score is always first, in example above 2 runs scored by favorite team

title: When game is postponed
custom_preconds: GIVEN a use on the team page
custom_steps:
WHEN there is a Postponed game present
AND the date bar is viewed
custom_expected: THEN the Postponed game will display day, date, Opponent, and "PPD"

title: When game is suspended
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team page
custom_steps:
WHEN there is a Suspended game present
AND the date bar is viewed
custom_expected: THEN the Suspended game will display date, Opponent, and "SUSP"

title: When game is suspended and resumed
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team page
custom_steps:
WHEN there is a Suspended-Resumed game displayed
AND the date bar is viewed
custom_expected:
THEN the Resumed Game will be displayed in the cell for the date that the game is being played on
AND when the user navigates to that cell, the date for the game will remain as the date the Resumed Game is scheduled to be played on
AND it will NOT be displayed on the date that the original Suspended Game was played on

title: When doubleheader is present
custom_preconds: GIVEN a use on the team page
custom_steps:
WHEN there is a Doubleheader present
AND the date bar is viewed
custom_expected:
THEN both games will get their own block
AND the games will be in the correct order based on start time
AND 'Game 2' will display in place of the start time for the second game

title: Doubleheader present; first game completed
custom_preconds: GIVEN a use on the team page
custom_steps:
WHEN there is a Doubleheader present
AND the first game has been completed
AND the date bar is viewed
custom_expected: THEN the second game will become the "featured" game

title: When game is cancelled
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user viewing the team snapshot schedule bar
custom_steps: WHEN a game is cancelled
custom_expected:
THEN CANC will display at the bottom of the cell
AND the opponent and date will also display

title: Hide Scores
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user with “Hide Scores” turned on
custom_steps: WHEN a game is in Final
custom_expected: THEN the schedule cell displays a dash in place of the score

title: Date Bar - All Star Game
custom_preconds: GIVEN a Favorite Team Snapshot (FTS)
custom_steps: WHEN the All-Star weekend activities enter the calendar
custom_expected: THEN the calendar tiles opponent should read ASG

title: Lower Resolution Layout
custom_preconds: GIVEN a device

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the viewport is below 360px
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN render 3 game chips

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the viewport is equal or above 360px
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN render 4 game chips

title: Preview w/ TBD Probables
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on a team Page
custom_steps: WHEN viewing a game in Preview w TBD Probables
custom_expected:
THEN game time (ex. 10:00 AM), Away Team logo, names, record will be seen
AND TBD over Home team logo, name, record

title: Preview w/ Probables
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the team Page
custom_steps: WHEN viewing a game in Preview w/ Probable Pitchers
custom_expected:
THEN Time (6:05 PM ET), Away Team logo, name, record
AND Home team logo, name, record
AND Home/Away probable Pitchers with stats on second line

title: Preview - Delayed Start
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team page
custom_steps:
WHEN viewing a game in Preview
AND the game is in Delayed Start
custom_expected:
THEN Time (ex. 6:05 PM) and 'Delayed' text will be seen
AND Away Team logo, name, record
AND TBD over record, pitcher information 
AND TBD over Venue Name, Venue Location

title: Preview - Back to Back Doubleheader
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on a team Page
custom_steps:
WHEN viewing a day with a doubleheader
AND both games are in Preview
custom_expected:
THEN the time will display for the first game
AND 'Game 2' will display in place of the time for the second game

title: Final - Postponed or Cancelled
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the team Page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN viewing a game that is Postponed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN POSTPONED text displays
AND Home/Away Team logo, name, record
AND Links for Details

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN viewing a game that is Cancelled
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN CANCELLED text displays
AND Home/Away Team logo, name, record
AND Links for Details

title: Live - Warmup
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the team Page
custom_steps: WHEN viewing a game in Warmup
custom_expected:
THEN Warmup state will be seen
AND No inning indicator
AND no data for the innings
AND Empty basepads and 0-0 count and 0 outs
AND empty Pitching and Batter data
AND Gameday buttons

title: Live - Top or Bottom
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the team Page
custom_steps: WHEN viewing a game in Top or Bottom of an inning
custom_expected:
THEN TOP or BOT with inning number will be seen
AND Accurate bases, count, outs
AND Pitching and Batter data with 'P:' and 'AB:' headings
AND Gameday buttons

title: Live - Mid or End
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the team Page
custom_steps: WHEN a user is viewing a game in Mid or End inning
custom_expected:
THEN MID or END with inning number will be seen
AND Accurate bases, count, outs
AND Pitching and Batter data
AND Gameday buttons

title: Live - Delay
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the team Page
custom_steps: WHEN viewing a game in an in-game delay
custom_expected:
THEN 'Delayed' text will display
AND Top or Bot (Bottom?) followed by inning number displays
AND Accurate bases, count, outs
AND Pitching and Batter data
AND Gameday buttons

title: Live - MLB.TV Free Game of the Day
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team Page
custom_steps: WHEN viewing the MLB.TV Free Game of the Day
custom_expected: THEN the user will see the MLB.TV Free Game of the Day label on the same line as the inning information

title: Live - Suspended w/o Resume
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the team Page
custom_steps: WHEN viewing a game in Suspended state
custom_expected:
THEN 'Suspended' text displays instead of inning information
AND the Gameday product button will display

title: Live - Suspended w/ Resume
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team Page
custom_steps: WHEN viewing a game in the Suspended state
custom_expected:
THEN 'Suspended' text with resume date displays instead of inning information
AND the Gameday product button will display

title: Live - Ump Review
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the team Page
custom_steps: WHEN viewing a game in an Ump Review
custom_expected: THEN 'Review' text will display instead of the inning info

title: Live - Team Challenge
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team Page
custom_steps: WHEN viewing a game in an Team Challenge
custom_expected: THEN the user will see 'Challange' text instead of the inning info

title: Live - Extra Innings
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team Page
custom_steps: WHEN viewing a game in extra innings
custom_expected: THEN the inning information will reflect the extra inning (ex. TOP 10)

title: Live - Perfect Game
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team Page
custom_steps: WHEN viewing a game that is a Perfect Game
custom_expected: THEN the Perfect game pill will be next to the inning information

title: Live - No Hitter
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team Page
custom_steps: WHEN a user is viewing a game that is a No Hitter
custom_expected: THEN the No-hitter pill will be next to the inning information

title: Final - Bottom 9th played
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team Page
custom_steps:
WHEN a user is viewing a final game 
AND the winning team is the home team
AND the bottom of the ninth is played
custom_expected:
THEN Final/<inning> will display in the center 
AND WIN LOSS pitcher info will display

title: Final - Bottom 9th not played
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team Page
custom_steps:
WHEN a user is viewing a final game 
AND the winning team is the home team
AND the bottom of the ninth is not played
custom_expected:
THEN Final text will be seen
AND the linescore with away team and record over home team and record
AND the bottom of the 9th frame has a X
AND W, L, S will be displayed

title: Final - Extra Innings
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team Page
custom_steps: WHEN viewing a final game that completed in extra innings
custom_expected: THEN Final and the inning information (Final/11) will be seen

title: Final - Completed Early
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the Team Page
custom_steps: WHEN viewing a final game that completed early
custom_expected: THEN user will see Final/<inning> in the center of the matchup

title: Final - Forfeit
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team page
custom_steps: WHEN viewing a final game that ended in a Forfeit
custom_expected:
THEN the completed game information will be seen
AND the status will be FORFEIT:<reason>/<inning>

title: Final - Perfect Game
custom_preconds: Given a user on the Team Page
custom_steps: WHEN viewing a game in final that is a Perfect Game
custom_expected: THEN the Perfect game pill will be next to the inning information

title: Final - No Hitter
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the Team Page
custom_steps: WHEN viewing a game in final that is a No-hitter
custom_expected: THEN the Perfect game pill will be next to the inning information

title: Hide Scores
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the Team Page
custom_steps: WHEN Hide Scores is turned on

custom_steps_separated.content: AND viewing a game in preview
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Start Time will be seen in the upper right

custom_steps_separated.content: AND viewing a game in progress
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Live will display
AND the pitcher/batting stats will be replaced by a skeleton
AND skeletons are shown in place of the scores / records / inning info / linescore

custom_steps_separated.content: AND viewing a game in final
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Final will be seen 
AND a skeleton is shown in place of the credited pitcher stats
AND a skeleton is shown in place of the scores / records / linescore

title: Suggested Date - invalid?
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user on the Team page
AND is running the debug micro app
custom_steps:
WHEN the suggested date in the microap config has been set to a date in the future
AND the users navs to the home page
custom_expected: THEN the date block and schedule snapshot will respected the suggested date set in the config

title: Final - Credited Pitcher Info Bar
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user viewing the team snapshot Credited Pitcher info bar
custom_steps: WHEN credited pitcher displays
custom_expected:
THEN W, L, S will display for Win, Loss, Save pitchers
AND the pitcher's logo will follow
AND the pitcher's last name will follow (TBD if not known)
AND the pitcher's position will follow (ex. LHP)
AND the next line will contain the stats: inningsPitched, strikeOuts, earnedRuns in the format ex. 2.2 IP | 5 K, 0 ER
AND the default stat values should be 0 if the value is not present in the data)

title: Preview - TBD Starting Pitcher
custom_preconds: GIVEN a game in preview mode
custom_steps: WHEN the team hasn’t announced their starting pitcher
custom_expected:
THEN the unannounced pitcher should show the fallback avatar spot
AND their name should be replaced with TBD
AND their stat line should be replaced with a dash
AND the Spanish translation will display when the device is set to Spanish, if configured

title: Live - Pitcher and Hitter position
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team snapshot
custom_steps: WHEN a game in the Live state
custom_expected:
THEN the pitcher should always be on the left
AND the hitter should always be on the right

title: Broadcaster info bar including accessibility
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user viewing the team snapshot matchup

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN broadcaster information is available for a game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the broadcast information bar will display
AND it will show the broadcaster of the game, ex. ESPN
AND the accessibility string should read "Watch on {broadcasters}"  |  "Ver en {broadcasters}"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN broadcaster information is not available for a game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN a dash "-" will display instead of broadcaster info
AND the accessibility string should read "Broadcasters not available" | "Transmisión no disponible"

title: Matchup - All Star Game
custom_preconds: GIVEN a game in the Team Snapshot module

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the game is an All Star Game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the American,National logos will display for the teams (see spec)
AND the team record of each team will display under their names

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the game is an All Star Game
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the player spots should be colored to their actual team (NYM, NYY, etc.)

title: Series status display in Broadcast info bar
custom_preconds: GIVEN a game
custom_steps: WHEN seriesStatusString is available
custom_expected:
THEN the value will be rendered in the Favorite Team Snapshot to the left of the broadcaster call letters on a single line
AND it will be truncated on the right if it does not fit with the broadcaster info

title: Preview or Final Date Display
custom_preconds: GIVEN a game in the FTS
custom_steps: WHEN the game is NOT live
custom_expected:
THEN include the Day (abbreviated) & Date (xx/xx)
AND position it above the Game State (Final) or Start Time

title: Players should be left-aligned and scrollable
custom_preconds: GIVEN a team snapshot
custom_steps: WHEN players are present in the view model data
custom_expected:
THEN those players should be displayed left aligned 
AND should be scrollable

title: Players Accessibility
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user on the team snapshot
AND the screen reader is on
custom_steps: WHEN a player is selected
custom_expected:
THEN the following will be read: (for example)
"The Winning pitcher was Kevin Gausman 10 and 10 recored with a 4.42 ERA""
AND
”The Losing Pitcher was Dean 5 and 10 recored with a 4.42 ERA"”
AND (if applicable)
"The Save Pitcher was Tad Green with 6 saves and a 4.42 ERA"

title: Hide Scores - Hide player spot colors
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team snapshot
custom_steps: WHEN hide scores is on
custom_expected: THEN the player spots should have the default grey background

title: Product Links - Final
custom_preconds: GIVEN a game is in Final

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the game is not Cancelled or Postponed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the following product links will display:
"Wrap” (Deep link to wrap)
"Box"
“Videos” (Deep link to video playlist)
“Story” (shows if story has url, triggers story popover) 

Spanish:
"Resuumen"
"Num"
"Videos"
"Historias"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the game is Cancelled or is Postponed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the following product links will display:
“Details” (Deep link to details)
“Story” (shows iff story has url, triggers story popover)

Spanish:
"Detallis"
"Historias"

title: Product Links - Live
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team snapshot matchup

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN a game is Live
AND the mediaState is set to on
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the following product links will be present:

“Gameday” (Deep link to gameday)
“MLB.TV” (Deep link to live stream or paywall)
“Audio” (Deep link to live stream or paywall)
“Story” Trigger Game Story (if story exists)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN a game is Live
AND the mediaState is set to off
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the following product links will be present:

“Gameday” (Deep link to gameday)
“Story” Trigger Game Story (if story exists)

title: Product Links - Preview
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the Team Snapshot
custom_steps: WHEN a game is in Preview

custom_steps_separated.content: AND the mediaState is set to off
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the following product buttons display:

“Preview” (Deep link to preview page)
“Tickets” (Webview link to buy tickets)
"Story" (if story exists)

custom_steps_separated.content: AND the mediaState is set to on
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the following product buttons display:

“Preview” (Deep link to preview page)
“MLB.TV” (Deep link to live stream or paywall)
“Audio” (Deep link to live stream or paywall)
“Tickets” (Webview link to buy tickets)
"Story" (if story exists)

Note: be sure to test the case where all 5 buttons display at once

title: Partner Product Links
custom_preconds: GIVEN a game in LIVE mode

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the game is exclusively broadcast by Apple TV+
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN replace MLB.TV product link with Apple TV+

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the game is exclusively broadcast by any other supported partner
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN replace MLB.TV product link with <Partner Name>

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN any of the partner links are tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN EPG will open and the behavior will be the same as tapping the game from epg

title: Hide Media Links when no media
custom_preconds: GIVEN a USER
custom_steps:
WHEN I see a LIVE game without Media on Team Snapshot

ex. below seen in api response for game	
"broadcasts": [],				
"dssMedia": {
"audio": [],
"mlbTv": []
}
custom_expected: THEN I will NOT see links to launch the media (Audio and MLB.tv)

title: PL - Scrolling behavior
custom_preconds: GIVEN a team snapshot
custom_steps: WHEN the list of product links is longer than the container due to the number of links and device display settings
custom_expected: THEN the products link should scroll

title: Analytics - Date Bar - Schedule tap
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team snapshot
custom_steps: WHEN schedule link is tapped in the date bar
custom_expected:
THEN the team schedule corresponding to team shown will open
AND the following tracking information is sent:

trackAction: "MLB App : Home Feed : <club abbreviation or 'MLB'> : Favorite Team Snapshot : Schedule Click"
action.element.text: <visible text on clicked element>
action.element.index: <index of item clicked in the array>
action.element.sectionIndex: <section index of module>

title: Analytics - Date Bar - Game tap
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team snapshot
custom_steps: WHEN a game cell is tapped in the date bar
custom_expected:
THEN the that will be the active game
AND the following tracking information is sent:

trackAction: "MLB App : Home Feed : <club abbreviation or 'MLB'> : Favorite Team Snapshot : Game Select Click"
action.element.index: <index of item clicked in the array>
action.element.sectionIndex: <section index of module>
game.state: <live, final, preview>
game.matchup: <The teams facing off and date, in format Away @ Home @ YYYY-MM-DD>
game.pk: <game PK>

title: Analytics - Product link tap
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I am on teamsnapshot
AND I have a Live game
AND Teamsnapshot appears as the 1st element in Home Surface
custom_steps: WHEN  I tap on "Gameday" product link for a "Live" game
custom_expected:
THEN the appropriate product page opens
AND the following tracking information is sent:

trackAction: "MLB At Bat : Android : Home Feed : MLB : Favorite Team Snapshot : Gameday Click"
action.element.text: Gameday
action.element.index: <index of item clicked in the array>
action.element.targetUrl: <target URL>
action.element.sectionIndex: 0
game.state: Live
game.matchup: <The teams facing off and date, in format Away @ Home @ YYYY-MM-DD>
game.pk: <game PK>

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN  I tap on "Audio" product link for a "Live" game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the appropriate product page opens
AND the following tracking information is sent:

trackAction: "MLB At Bat : Android : Home Feed : MLB : Favorite Team Snapshot : Audio Click"
action.element.text: Audio
action.element.index: <index of item clicked in the array>
action.element.targetUrl: <target URL>
action.element.sectionIndex: 0
game.state: Live
game.matchup: <The teams facing off and date, in format Away @ Home @ YYYY-MM-DD>
game.pk: <game PK>

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN  I tap on "MLB.TV" product link for a "Live" game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the appropriate product page opens
AND the following tracking information is sent:

trackAction: "MLB At Bat : Android : Home Feed : MLB : Favorite Team Snapshot : MLB.TV Click"
action.element.text: MLB.TV
action.element.index: <index of item clicked in the array>
action.element.targetUrl: <target URL>
action.element.sectionIndex: 0
game.state: Live
game.matchup: <The teams facing off and date, in format Away @ Home @ YYYY-MM-DD>
game.pk: <game PK>

title: Analytics - Content Tap
custom_preconds: GIVEN a team snapshot is configured
custom_steps: WHEN a user clicks on content in the team snapshot
custom_expected:
THEN make a track state call with the following content:

trackAction: "MLB App : Home Feed : <club abbreviation or 'MLB'> : My Follows : Team Snapshot : <Article|Video> Click"
action.element.text: <visible text on clicked element - article or video title>
action.element.index: <index of item clicked in the array>
action.element.targetUrl: <target URL>
action.element.sectionIndex: <section index of module>
action.element.sectionTitle: “My Follows" 
game.state: <live, final, preview>
game.matchup: <The teams facing off and date, in format Away @ Home @ YYYY-MM-DD>
game.pk: <game PK>
team.traffic: <team name abbreviation>

title: Analytics - Team Story Tap
custom_preconds: GIVEN a team snapshot
custom_steps: WHEN a user clicks on a team tap story
custom_expected:
THEN a track state call is sent with the following contents:

trackAction: "MLB App : Home Feed : <club abbreviation or 'MLB'> : My Follows : Team Snapshot : Tap Story Click"
action.element.text: <visible text on clicked element>
action.element.index: <index of item clicked in the array>
action.element.targetUrl: <target URL>
action.element.sectionIndex: <section index of module>
action.element.sectionTitle: “My Follows" 
game.state: <live, final, preview>
game.matchup: <The teams facing off and date, in format Away @ Home @ YYYY-MM-DD>
game.pk: <game PK>
team.traffic: <team name abbreviation>

title: Analytics - Pitching Info - Player tap
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the team snapshot
custom_steps: WHEN a player name or image is tapped in the pitching info section
custom_expected:
THEN that player's page opens
AND the following tracking information is sent:

trackAction: "MLB App : Home Feed : <club abbreviation or 'MLB'> : Favorite Team Snapshot : Player Click"
action.element.index: <index of item clicked in the array>
action.element.sectionIndex: <section index of module>
game.state: <live, final, preview>
game.matchup: <The teams facing off and date, in format Away @ Home @ YYYY-MM-DD>
game.pk: <game PK>
player.id: <player ID>

title: Home - Postseason - End of Postseason Game Display rules
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on the Team Snapshot

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the current date is 2 or 1 days before the team's last game of regular season
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the date bar shows the team's last 4 games of the season (or 3 depending on display/font size settings

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the current date is the last day of regular season
AND before the flip to show next season
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the date bar shows last 4 games of the season (or 3 depending on display/font size setting)

title: Team Snapshot - Schedule Tap
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user on a Team Snapshot Module
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the “Schedule” icon or text
custom_expected:
THEN open up the native complete schedule for that team
AND check that the schedule is populated with games as expected

title: Team Snapshot - Preview: Matchup tap
custom_preconds: GIVEN a matchup in Preview mode
custom_steps: WHEN a user taps anywhere within the matchup bounds
custom_expected: THEN the user is taken to the Game Preview

title: Team Snapshot - Live: Matchup Tap
custom_preconds: GIVEN a matchup in Live mode
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps anywhere within the matchup bounds
custom_expected: THEN the user is taken to Gameday for that game

title: Team Snapshot - Final: Matchup Tap
custom_preconds: GIVEN a matchup in Final mode
custom_steps: WHEN a user taps anywhere within the matchup bounds
custom_expected: THEN they are taken to the Game Wrap

title: Team Snapshot - Product Links: Preview tap
custom_preconds: GIVEN a list of product links
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps “Preview”
custom_expected: THEN the Game Preview is opened via a pop over

title: Team Snapshot - Product Links: Tickets tap
custom_preconds: GIVEN a list of product links
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps “Tickets”
custom_expected: THEN the webview for tickets for that game is opened

title: Team Snapshot - Product Links: Gameday tap
custom_preconds: GIVEN a list of product links
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps “Gameday”
custom_expected: THEN the user is taken to Gameday for that game

title: Team Snapshot - Product Links: MLB.TV tap
custom_preconds: GIVEN a live game

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is entitled
AND the game is not blacked-out
AND they tap on MLB.TV
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the game will begin streaming

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is entitled
AND the game is blacked-out
AND they tap on MLB.TV
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the blackout message will display

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is a Free user 
AND the game is not blacked-out
AND they tap on MLB.TV
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is taken to the paywall

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is not logged in 
AND the game is not blacked-out
AND they tap on MLB.TV
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is taken to the paywall

title: Team Snapshot - Product Links: Audio tap
custom_preconds: GIVEN a live game

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is entitled
AND they tap on Audio
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN audio EPG will open
AND the game audio will begin streaming

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is a Free user or not logged in 
AND they tap on Audio
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN audio EPG will open
AND the user is taken to the audio paywall

title: Team Snapshot - Preview: Pitcher Tap
custom_preconds: GIVEN a matchup in Preview mode
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects on a pitcher (spot, name, or stats)
custom_expected: THEN the player page opens as a pop over

title: Team Snapshot - Live: Player Tap
custom_preconds: GIVEN a matchup in Live mode
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps a player (spot, name, or stats)
custom_expected: THEN the player page opens as a pop over

title: Team Snapshot - Final: Pitcher Tap
custom_preconds: GIVEN a matchup in Final mode
custom_steps: WHEN a user taps on a pitcher (spot, name, or stats)
custom_expected: THEN the player page opens as a pop over
